thread.title: National Weather Service confirms 4th tornado touched down from Tuesdays storms
thread.title_full: National Weather Service confirms 4th tornado touched down from Tuesdays storms

author: @wilxTV
title: National Weather Service confirms 4th tornado touched down from Tuesdays storms
text: National Weather Service confirms 4th tornado touched down from Tuesdays storms ST. JOSEPH COUNTY, Mich. (WILX) - The National Weather Service (NWS) has confirmed that a 4th tornado touched down in Michigan during Tuesday, May 7, storms. The NWS says an EF2 tornado touched down around 5:40 p.m. in St. Joseph Co, on the south side of Centreville and traveled northeast passing north of Colon, crossing into Branch Co, near Goodrich Lake, causing extensive to trees and homes including loss of roofs, and walls. The tornado traveled close to 20 miles and had estimated winds up to 130 mph and was about 950 yards in length. There were no fatalities reported however there was one injury. On Wednesday, May 8, Gov Gretchen Whitmer called for a [State of Emergency](https://www.wilx.com/2024/05/08/severe-storms-leave-behind-significant-damage-southwest-michigan-governor-whitmer-declares-state-emergency/) for all counties that were effected with significant damage in Southwest Michigan.
